page.title: 05Wildlife in Newton Toney
page.content: {Newton Toney}is a very green peaceful village. There is a river called the {Bourne.}It twists through the village and runs through {Allington}and { {Boscombe}also. When it is hot in the summer the river can dry up completely and even the tadpoles were having trouble trying to breath.{Mrs Pownall lives in Newton Toney. She told us that people throw buckets of water into the river to try and save the tadpoles.Then we saw quite a lot of house martins .There weren't many farm animals around. We saw a few water spiders, some minnows and some frogs spawn. There were lots of neat gardens and hedges which were well looked after. We saw some dragonflies and bumble bees and some moor hens by the river bank and some craneflies.
